page.title: 14A day in my life - Hannah
page.content: It is the end of a wet week at{Pilton {Pop Festival. }Everyone packed their bags to go. Away from the mud, to beautiful sunshine and lush green grass. No-one would guess that there had once been grass at Worthy Farm; now there was only mud: sloppy, sticky and mushy. Driving out the wheels spun , spitting mud everywhere. The roads were sloshy, though they began to dry and now six miles away everything was dry, green and perfect. The sun was high in the sky, and was a wonderful orangey- yellow. We walked into our garden and were met by trillions of flowers, beautiful outbursts of colour. My brother and I dumped everythingand ran outside to make sunbeds, they were amazingly soft, and it seemed like paradise lying there sipping fruit juice.
